website_summaries.verdict: A small, narrow – and very popular – propane grill that is perfect for restricted spaces outdoors.
pros: Side shelves fold inward for convenient storage when not in use
Cooking surface is just large enough for most types of grilling
Ideal for small home living and apartment life
cons: Small profile might not be enough for true grilling connoisseurs

customer_reviews.title: Best grill I ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Weber grills are expensive, but they seem to be worth it. Control knobs rotate a full 270 degrees rather than the typical 90 degrees for much better heat control. The fat drip system is well designed to eliminate the mess you usually get with cheaper grills. Comes to grilling temperature very quickly. Best grill I ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: David Richard

customer_reviews.title: If you have the money, get it.
customer_reviews.text: Was able to build it up nice and easy, everything was undamaged and worked like a charm. Quality of the product is outstanding. The fuel gauge is weight based (You hang your tank from it) so it doesn't give a really accurate reading. BIGGEST THING TO KNOW I'd that the temperature dials are technically backwards. Turning them counterclockwise DECREASES the flame. So basically, when you first ignite the grill you are technically at the highest flame output/ temp.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Stepherson

customer_reviews.title: Some reviews are misleading. Nothing wrong if you install correct
customer_reviews.text: I just got this and installed it in less than 1.5 hours. Easy to install, the instructions were crystal clear and if the paper is not good for you, there is an app with 3d instructions. So reviews that say no instructions.. weird. Reviews that say hole in the middle too big and lp tank falls thru (others that say they even had to improvise parts to cover the hole).. it was meant to have a hole in the middle, it’s for the tank to be suspended so you can see how much gas is left. The tank is suspended on the hook in order to check gas level( added pictures). Heats up fast, very easy to install. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Trandafirescu

customer_reviews.title: Great grill
customer_reviews.text: I had a Webber grill but I gave it to my nephew. What a mistake that was because I bought a different kind to replace it and the replacement was nothing but a bunch of junk even though it cost more. Now I am back to where I was in the first place and happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Love Weber products, but not this one.
customer_reviews.text: I have been very happy with Weber grills I've purchase in the past. I held off posting a review of this product because I purchased it at the end of the season and thought the poor performance may have been related to the cold windy weather at the time. However, that was not the case. With temperatures in the 70s and no wind, this Weber Spirit 2 burner grill has been disappointing. With the propane full on and both burners turned up all the say, it takes about two hours to cook a medium steak. The gauge goes up to 600, but I have not been able to get it over 300. With the slightest breeze, the burners go out.
customer_reviews.author: P. Spivey

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I saved up for this grill
customer_reviews.text: The two main features I was looking for in a gas grill, was a compact footprint for our balcony and one that won't rust through in five years. The top and bottom enclosures of this grill are thick-walled aluminum castings -- can't rust through, ever. Heat is even. Thermostat seems accurate. Has a hanging scale that constantly keeps track of the weight of your propane tank -- i.e., a fuel gauge. This grill is more than I wanted to spend but I won't be buying another for decades. (I had it assembled for me -- more money well spent.)
customer_reviews.author: Wardy

customer_reviews.title: Nice grill!
customer_reviews.text: This grill is great. I like the door on this one better than the open look of the newer version. Actually, when we first opened it, the door was bent, but they sent us a new one quickly. It took two of us about an hour and a half to put it together and the directions were easy to follow. Cooking on it is great. I was worried that it’d be too small, but it’s actually perfect. You can fit about 8-10 burgers at a time, which is plenty for our needs. I also love that the sides fold down; it’s really efficient with space. The quality is definitely there with this grill- totally happy we got it!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: best bbq grill we have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: great bbq grill. instructions were clear and easy to follow. we have used our new Weber several times already - enjoy it and learning how to tweak cooking directions as we go - temp drops whenever lid is lifted. Also, weather will make a difference in recovery time - wind is a big factor. we have started a notebook on each item so we know what adjustments we need to make in heat and time when we use it in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Cou

customer_reviews.title: Weber no longer stands behind their products like they used to
customer_reviews.text: After only 9 months of use, the igniter is no longer working. Changed the battery, checked the wires, no apparent issues, JUST STOPPED WORKING. We bought last March, put it together last April, got ONE SUMMER of grilling, its been in storage for the winter and when we pulled it out last month, NO LONGER WORKING. This is NOT ACCEPTABLE FOR WEBER. Sorry we purchased. It is out of warranty by 1 month, but based on other reviews, doesnt really matter, Weber no longer stands behind their products like they used to.
customer_reviews.author: BASHA

customer_reviews.title: Will not last outside
customer_reviews.text: A decent entry level propane grill. Clear assembly instructions. Took off two stars because it rusted thru on the bottom skirt where door hinges attach and ignition stopped working, despite being covered. If you buy this, make sure to spray it seasonally with corrosion stopper (3M Fluid Film). Additionally, waterproofing the grill cover seems like a good idea to keep moisture off and prolong the life. Replacing the parts I mentioned above are more expensive than the grill so I will go with another brand for my next purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gaddis

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Grill
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this grill in Feb 2015 and since we have had to replace one burner and just recently one of the valves seems to be broken. Still we continue to use it, but replacing the valve is on my to-do list before BBQ season starts. It is such a good grill and I see the issues so far as just normal maintenance. I would not change my star rating over either issue.
customer_reviews.author: John in Mill Creek WA

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely LOVE my Weber
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE my Weber! This grill is perfect for a 2-4 person family. It has two burners, which has a larger grill surface area than I expected. The assembly was easier than I expected and it took me approximately 1.5 hours from start to finish. The grill is easy to light and operate and I am usually grilling within 5-10 minutes. I also love that it has 4 wheels, so we can move it away from our house, where it is stored. I will never buy another grill!!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Parent

customer_reviews.title: Quality, of course, it’s a a Weber
customer_reviews.text: Happy to have found this model grill on Amazon with the cabinet. Grill is nice, I mean it’s a Weber! Only thing is it seems to have a design flaw. The propane tank sits in a hole in the cabinet on the patio floor. This makes it impossible to move the grill without manually lugging the tank around. We had to retrofit a solution so the tank didn’t sit on the ground so we can move the grill easily now. Also the cover arrived cracked, one call to Weber and we had a new cover in 2 days!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill
customer_reviews.text: Great Grill, but not easy to set up. It took me about an hour to put together. Directions weren't totally clear. Put some things on backwards first and had to redo. It says two people set up, but most guys can do by themselves, but it isn't quick so make sure you have the time. I used to buy cheap grills, but they usually last 6 months. This one has a much longer life. I'd say 5 or 6 years from my last purchase. I use approx twice a week.
customer_reviews.author: Bud Kilmer

customer_reviews.title: Weber makes the Best Grill
customer_reviews.text: This Weber Grill is the Best Grill I have ever owned. This is also my First Weber Grill. All I could ask myself is WHY, did I wait so long!!! Now I can see why Weber is # 1. I do not find it to be too small, you can fit plenty of food on this Grill Very easy to control the Temperature, very even heating. It has a cast aluminum fire box, that will not rust away like the other cheaper brands. Very well made, do not waste your money on others, buy a Weber!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas J. Macchia

customer_reviews.title: Love this grill!
customer_reviews.text: Just received and assembled this grill. Instructions looked intimidating at first, however, they were perfect. Quality and everything fit perfectly. Extremely pleased and I'm a 65 year old woman who had no problem. The initial package was very heavy so just take it apart and it's not too heavy even though I had a lumbar fusion.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Perch

customer_reviews.title: This grill is as good as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This grill is as good as advertised. I can't believe how perfectly it cooks stuff. My old grill had hot spots and cold spots and so using it was not easy and food came out unevenly cooked all the time. A couple of things to consider: it's great for our family of four, but it's not designed to cook more than say 8 burgers at a time. Also, I've seen some reviews that talk about how hot this grill gets, and it's true. It can get up to 500 degrees very quickly so you gotta be on top of things. Overall it's a great grill for the money and I would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: melissa palmer

customer_reviews.title: Beware of free assembly verbage.
customer_reviews.text: I clicked on the box for free assembly, but unit was brought in a box, unassembled. Delivery person offered to take it back, but didn't know how long it would take to get it back to me...disappointed. This is the bullet points describing "what you get with your purchase". Don't even know how many stars to give it because I can't use it right now... Assembly of 1 customer-supplied grill, including connecting customer-supplied propane tank. Connecting to a natural gas line is not included. Moving product to another location is not included Typical assembly time of 3 hours Removal of packaging materials to customer's bin Products requiring additional work may result in an updated estimate from provider
customer_reviews.author: deborah crist

customer_reviews.title: This one is not a smaller version of the 4 burner model - its about half the size but only about 25% as good as the larger Weber
customer_reviews.text: This is replacing a Weber 4 burner model I had for about 14 years. This one is not a smaller version of the 4 burner model - its about half the size but only about 25% as good as the larger Weber. The E210 has distinct hot spots and distinct cold spots on the grill so it requires pretty constant movement of your food to ensure consistency.
customer_reviews.author: MikeJulieSTL

customer_reviews.title: Almost a great delivery
customer_reviews.text: It comes in so many pieces I knew I wouldn’t b able to assemble myself. BUT. Thanks to YouTube videos put together was a piece cake. The guy made an amazing job explaining and showing step by step. So if u buy it and is not the best puzzle person, make sure u watch the YouTube video. Another issue. The bottom of my grill and the door had a smash. I did my best to fix it. Return big items is usually a pain so I rather live w the little smash instead deal w return or exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for small groups
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic grill for small groups (~6-8 people). Heats up quickly and cooks evenly. It looks good, it's compact and takes up very little room, and the foldable side tables are very useful. Assembly was quite a bit of work, but the instructions are clear. If I ever get another I might just pay for the assembly. I've had it for almost two years now. The only thing I've had to replace was the tray that collected drippings. Overall highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Hin

customer_reviews.title: The quality is clear
customer_reviews.text: We've always had cheap grills, and they were always lacking, so I decided to try spending a few bucks. I can see the quality in the build of this grill. It's heavy, the side tables collapse very easily when I want them to, it gets hot enough. We don't grill that much, so we'll see how long it lasts -- that's kind of key for us, because our other grills have had components that tend to rust out. This Weber is a definite improvement on the cheaper grills we've previously owned, but the jury is out as to whether it's worth 2 to 4 times the price of those cheaper grills.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Circeo

customer_reviews.title: A great little grill
customer_reviews.text: Of course, it's more expensive, but this grill will outlast the others and it produces a delicious product. You usually get what you pay for and unless you want to start replacing parts in lesser grills after 2-3 years, go with the better grill.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lawless

customer_reviews.title: I must eat healthier and cheaper
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time. The inside of the door is a bit bent, but it is not noticeable on the outside. Fits on my apartment balcony with 1/2 inch to spare on each side (I had to not install the left tray to make it fit, which I had planned for). Great grill. My neighbor is jealous. He has a cool portable Weber, but knows mine is sweeter. Ha. The assembly was a cinch, I put it together by myself two days after having hernia surgery.
customer_reviews.author: RJM

customer_reviews.title: It's a Weber.  And now I know why they are pricey - they work - always.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, it's a Weber. I always looked at these in the store (and ended buying cheaper brands) but thought they were over priced for what they are. I don't think that anymore. This thing just WORKS. Easily assembled as well. Quality, period!
customer_reviews.author: J. Milani

customer_reviews.title: A great value, high quality grill.
customer_reviews.text: We love this grill! It heats up quickly and cooks food beautifully. The design is clever - the grill is nicely compact when the side tables are folded away, but the tables are easy to fold out and very stable. This is not the cheapest grill out there, but it cooks evenly and is well manufactured (you'll have to assemble it yourself unless you want to pay someone to do it for you). Bottom line- a high quality grill which cooks really well and looks good doing it.
customer_reviews.author: EMCC

customer_reviews.title: you have to assemble it
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift. I was horrified when my daughter sent me a picture of all the parts spred out on her floor. I had no idea that it would come like that. I have one and I love it. it has never failed to start with one click. temperatue is easy to control, it's a great grill. mine came assembled. I'd give the grill 10 stars but the assembly was not easy, according to my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Grill.. Very happy with Weber
customer_reviews.text: Love this grill. Have used many times..Easy to assemble (under and hour). Durable and great cooking space on the cooking grates. I love the 2 side panels that extend/open and close very easy to hold additional food, cooking utensils. Easy to clean..great value. Highly recommended. Rolls back and forth easily when you want to use and then put back into storage area I always have used a weber charcoal grill - so I am a loyal Weber user - however new place I moved into only allows gas grills. Everything has worked very well right from the get go
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Less than 6 years, it stopped working completely.
customer_reviews.text: I wish this unit could last more than 6 years. It worked great when it was working, but we checked everything (gas tank, ignition, etc), nothing is working! Very frustrated!!! It stopped working after 5 1/2 years.
customer_reviews.author: S. Halim

customer_reviews.title: It's ok but not good for steak.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good-ish little bbq. Thermometer goes up and up and then you put the steak on and it doesn't sear or get very brown. If you want fairly low temps it works great for things like chicken thighs. Like the fact that the battery and module for the starter are underneath the bbq, behind the door. Fairly easy to put together, but don't try to wing it follow the directions carefully.
customer_reviews.author: Willy

customer_reviews.title: Impressive quality
customer_reviews.text: Having assembled a lot of products over the years, I was very impressed by the quality and attention to detail from Weber on this grill. Assembly took some time, but the instructions were very clear and all of the parts were present, well packaged, and easy to put together. I didn't find any rough edges or misaligned connection points anywhere. The only thing which I would change is that you have to press in the dials in order to turn them completely off.
customer_reviews.author: C S Jones

customer_reviews.title: Weber is the King of BBQ's! Lasts forever!
customer_reviews.text: My last WEBER was pre-owned by a friend who used it for over ten years..they cleaned it up, gave it to me, and I used it for another 18+ years...they never die!!!!! I finally decided it was time for a new one so am hoping this will last just as long. Only regret is that I should have gotten the next size up for larger parties but it worked fine for ribs & chicken for 18 guests!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ginger B.

customer_reviews.title: I've always loved my Weber grills and bought this one as a ...
customer_reviews.text: Cabinet door damaged, won't close properly. I've always loved my Weber grills and bought this one as a housewarming gift for my sister. Part of my "gift" to her was to assemble the grill for her. I was very disappointed to find that the door for the front of the grill was damaged. Grill will still work, but I'm bummed that there's a problem right out of the gate. Amazon, unfortunately, makes it nearly impossible to report this type of problem and rectify the situation. Would welcome any input from Amazon Customer Service on how to solve problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen M. Kinsella

customer_reviews.title: Friends and family said its the best and it lasts
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Weber grill.Friends and family said its the best and it lasts.I will say it is the easy to put together,the direction are made for men.Men look at pictures,instructions are pictured and easy to follow.The best part is that all fasteners are package separate so there is no guessing and are marked A,B,C,etc.It does take approx 2hrs to assemble.All instructions should be this simple.
customer_reviews.author: Tony C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and ultra reliable gas grill
customer_reviews.text: Arrived super fast with prime and came with relatively easy to follow installation instructions. Don't let the compact size fool you. This grill is perfect for us as a couple but works wonders with guests over. Easily can fit up to 12 burgers on this grill plus the top rack for warming buns. The ignition switch works flawlessly and the propane gauge is an amazing feature to ensure you won't run out of gas mid grilling session. Don't waste your money on a low quality grill. Invest in this and you will be happy for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Temperamental Temperature
customer_reviews.text: The Weber grill has an issue with its fuel regulator causing it to not stay at 500 degrees
customer_reviews.author: Larry W Clark

customer_reviews.title: Love our first Weber
customer_reviews.text: Delivered professionally. No damage to the box or to any of the parts. Very nice grill for our family of two. Well made, and was easy to go together. Everything fit as intended, and it took me approximately two hours, while taking my time. We have already used this several times now, and look forward to many more grilling nights on the patio! We also purchased the Weber SS grilling pan and basket. Both have come in handy so far!
customer_reviews.author: Michael60

customer_reviews.title: Solid, well-built grill
customer_reviews.text: The box and its contents arrived undamaged. It took me about 90 minutes to assemble. The instructions (pictures only, no words) were clear enough. I was very surprised to find that screws and washers are all plastic. I mangled the head on one of them when the screwdriver slipped. The grill lights up quickly and easily. There's good control over the intensity of the flame. According to the thermometer on the cover, it heated to 500 degrees in about ten minutes with both burners lit. Every grill I've had before this one were the $99 specials at the local big box store. This Weber cost 4x as much, but I can see and feel the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Since 1998

customer_reviews.title: Excellent grill and very easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: This is our second (they last about 5 years with heavy use) and we love the thing. This time I opted to assemble myself and it was perfect. Took about an hour to assemble and every single part down to the washers was included which is pretty danged unusual for DIY assemblies. Can not say enough good about the grill, assembly and delivery. Well done all around.
customer_reviews.author: J. Michael Dearen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent in every respect
customer_reviews.text: I’m 63 and have never written a review but I wanted to for this grill. Takes some time to assemble but each step has a lettered bag of hardware that corresponds to just that step(never seen that before). The grill really does cook better than any I’ve ever owned and I’ve had several, if it holds up like a weber should it will be well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: vanessa wilfong

customer_reviews.title: Don't sacrafice quality for quantity!
customer_reviews.text: Without a doubt one of my wisest purchases in quite some time. We had a charbroil infrared grill for 5 years. They were no help. The entire base rusted out, no where to put new flavorizer bars, grates rusted quickly, etc... I should have bought this grill a long time ago and spent the extra money. I always said quality over quantity, I should have listened to myself. Shipping was ontime as usual. Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: retlt

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Grill
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for the two of us. Well designed and works flawlessly. It is a little fussy, but straightforward to assemble, with excellent directions. I was able to assemble by myself in about an hour. Well packaged for shipping, which means you will have a lot of cardboard to recycle when you are finished. I bought my dad a Weber 11 years ago and it is still running strong. I expect this one to last as long. It costs a bit more than bargain brands, but is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Turley

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and works great
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to assemble. It took us 1.5 hours and the instructions were easy to follow. The grill is great quality! The only place they were cheap on was the door handle (plastic) but other wise we are impressed with the quality overall.
customer_reviews.author: Sjwcslook

customer_reviews.title: What a beauty
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of going through charcoal grills - the cheaper ones just start falling apart after a few years. I decided to go back to my roots (my first grill was a Weber charcoal) that I really liked and lasted forever. I wasn't wrong - really great quality and features that you normally don't have on the cheaper ones. Though Weber costs more than a lot of them out there, it really is worth the few extra $$. I thought this one was going to be smaller than it is - very surprised at the actual grilling surface size. The quality is super. I think this will be the last grill I will ever have to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl D Long

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Why does this grill cost so much more than other grills? Because it's worth it. Solid construction, cast iron grates, incredibly well designed. I could not be happier, I should have bought a Weber years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: It is a great small grill
customer_reviews.text: It is a great small grill. Unfortunately- I don't believe bad luck was involved- twice it was shipped to me with bent parts that were packed inside the undamaged box it came in. This is the only Weber grill that is not made in the U.S.
customer_reviews.author: Bogdanova

customer_reviews.title: No Remorse- well worth the upgrade !
customer_reviews.text: So glad that I finally went for the Weber ! After years of less expensive grills . I decided to treat myself and I am not disappointed. Big upgrade of materials used in construction- should last 10 years easily. I grill year round in NJ weather and use premium grill covers on my grills. Grill came well-packed and unassembled Easy to follow instructions- fun project if you take your time!
customer_reviews.author: Toydaddy

customer_reviews.title: Best grill ever!
customer_reviews.text: This grill is amazing! High quality materials, it’s all coated so it won’t rust as fast, and the instructions are so simple to follow. Everything is easily labeled, and separated in bags together so you only take the parts you need. It’s the best grill we’ve ever had
customer_reviews.author: Jill Johnstone

customer_reviews.title: Using it 3-4 times a week for the last 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE. I am not a tool girl or mechanical, and I was able to put this together one night after I got it, since then I use it 3-4 times a week for the last 3-4 months, I love it and how easy it is to use, and best thing is the size of the grill area is PERFECT, big enough to do a slap of ribs or a chicken but small enough to not waste gas heating areas I wont use for my small family. It really holds heat easily, and heats up quickly. Only thing is the wheels unlocking and locking to move around isn't easy to do with my not strong hands.
customer_reviews.author: Jane doe

customer_reviews.title: Love this grill!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as an upgrade to a Charbroil grill and could not be happier. It's so much easier to get a consistent temperature with the Weber grill which leads to a better cook. Assembly was easy and took less than an hour from opening the box to firing it up.
customer_reviews.author: Kords

customer_reviews.title: A quality product
customer_reviews.text: Really high quality, easy to assemble. Just take your time and read all of the instructions. I came without a dent packed for shipping. Just on issue, I will be calling as the first time I grilled chicken the pan did not catch all of the grease to I have some spots on my concrete.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Z

customer_reviews.title: This is a great grill which is easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This is a great grill which is easy to clean. The one draw back is the tank sits directly on the ground. So when the grill needs to be moved, the tank needs to be lifted up and out to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Charla K. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Webers are great - My 2nd one
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Weber grill. Quality with even heating wherever you place your food. Have used less expensive grills before and as always you get what you pay for. Webers last longer so they're worth it.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Heckel

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this grill because I wanted to downsize. Have used the grill several times and am very pleased with the grill and food prepared on it. Have been a Weber owner for years.
customer_reviews.author: vjs

customer_reviews.title: Marvel of packaging and assembly
customer_reviews.text: Must say, very impressed at the engineering that went into designing this grill for owner assembly. The screws, bolts and machined threads they fit into were flawless all around. The packaging was quite impressive, too. Took me 30 minutes to unhusk the parts, another 1:30 to assemble. All parts present and accounted for. The assembly pictogram instruction was a little confusing on what NOT to do, but overall very easy to follow the 26 steps. And of course, it's a Weber gas grill, so there you have it.
customer_reviews.author: JimT.

customer_reviews.title: Lid cracked
customer_reviews.text: After first use lid cracked. Weber asked for pictures and will deliver new once they look at pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Angelos Spetseris

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great quality grill. So glad I invested a little more to get this Weber grill. I like the Spirit E210 because there is a door to hide the propane tank. I suggest getting the cover and the cleaning kit which are made especially for this grill
customer_reviews.author: Gail M

customer_reviews.title: Pricey - but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. Weber grills are a bit pricey but I think that you get what you pay for. The grill comes in a huge box that weighs about 100 pounds syou'll need help moving it and getting everything unpacked. Assembly is pretty easy - I'm an experienced wrench turner and it took me about an hour. I've cooked burgers and a couple of steaks of it and the food was great.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: It's great for cooking for the two of us
customer_reviews.text: It's great for cooking for the two of us. The gas gauge is great and I like the door, though we don't have much stored in it other than the grill brush. Sturdy and the fold-able sides go down so that the grill cover fits over it. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Julie Goun

customer_reviews.title: Weber Rocks .... as usual
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son-in-law who has been the victim of a box store grill for way to long - He has a small patio and this does the job ....... the folding tables are the perfect touch - Grills just like my Weber Summit but in a compact version = The smaller size is actually a plus in that the grill heats up to 500 degrees in under 10 minutes - As expected the usual terrific Weber sear markings - Plenty of room on the grates to fit enough food for 6 people If you love to grill but are limited on space this grill will make you a hero
customer_reviews.author: Markus Discus

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this grill. Small enough for a couple but big enough when you have guest over. Easy to move around my deck and does not burn my meat with flame ups. Perfect cooking.
customer_reviews.author: N K O

customer_reviews.title: BBQ-weber
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these gas BBQs. Weber is a great product, parts easy to get, long lasting BBQ. I always purchase stainless steel grates because I like them a lot. Wish you could buy the BBQ will stainless steel grates when new.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HUBBY IS SO HAPPY
customer_reviews.text: We talked about getting a Weber Grill for the last 14 years. Instead of coming up with a few more bucks, hubby always got the cheap gas grills and replaced them about every year. We finally bit the bullet this year and my husband LOVES HIS GRILL. He put it together using the instructions!!! That in itself is worth 5 stars. It went together with no problems and he has cooked on it almost every night. He goes out to dust it off and cover it as soon as it cools down. He never even took care of the kids like this! We've had this for about a month or two, and we can't say enough positive things about it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bloyer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent grill.  Definitely worth the investment.
customer_reviews.text: The grill came in 3 days and was packaged well. The box did have some damage to it but the product was not damaged. The grill went together well and starts up with the if ignite button on first try. The grill gets real hot and has a door with a compartment for the propane tank. I would definitely recommend this grill and make the investment on this as opposed to another rand cause the quality of the materials used in this grill are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Brans

customer_reviews.title: Quality craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: LOVE The quality of this grill. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: R. M

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill Starts on first try!
customer_reviews.text: I was sad to see my last Weber grill go....the tubes eventually rusted out, but not after at least 3 yrs. of all year round use! I knew I wanted a Weber again. Too many years before I had bought other brands only to have them die after one yr. Researched this grill and read the reviews. Ordered from Amazon, competitive price, even to regional sellers, free shipping. Came packaged really well and was easy to put together, if you follow the directions. Started on the first try. Love that! Hopefully this grill will last as long as the last one. Heats up fast, sufficient cooking space. I use it almost every day, I love grilling- veggies, fish,chicken etc.
customer_reviews.author: DreamerNorth

customer_reviews.title: and I like that the side tables fold down for storage
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a smaller grill to replace a different brand stainless steel one that rusted....yes...explain that to me. Anyways, I got this guy. Initial it came with a dented door panel, but I was able to as bel everything else, and weber sent me a replacement faster than I think I've ever gotten a replacement part. Over a year later, the grill is holding up well. The gas gauge is a big plus, and I like that the side tables fold down for storage, I bought the cover that goes with it and all work together great!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: I love this grill
customer_reviews.text: I love this grill. I've had several over the years, but this is by far the best one I ever had. Heavy duty, solid, well-built, well-designed. I have a large propane tank for the house (range and tankless hot water heater), so I had the plumber create a separate outlet on the deck for the grill. I had to remove the regulator from the grill in order for the connections to work, but my tank has a regulator already so it is not a problem. Works great. I've had it several months, and very glad I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Deirdre M. Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Happy with grill, but not delivery.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great grill, but be advised that it will take hours to assemble. Instructions were generally straightforward. I was able to do all of the assembly with a phillips screwdriver and a small socket wrench. One issue: the bottom base of the grill was pretty dented up and needed to straightened out--I am guessing this was a shipping issue.
customer_reviews.author: Trubbaman

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for a well used WEBER that just got too old.
customer_reviews.text: Love this grill, I wanted the two 50% burners so when cooking a small amount of food, I don't have to have all the burners on. Gas burning ontrol is very linear and adjustable, cooks everything just right, even toasting the burger buns nicely.
customer_reviews.author: BobY

customer_reviews.title: Looking good
customer_reviews.text: This model is superior to newer Weber models as it hides the propane tank inside the grill.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C. Marineau

customer_reviews.title: This grill lasted exactly 2.5 years  before it started falling apart
customer_reviews.text: This grill lasted exactly 2.5 years before it started falling apart. I have a high quality cover and cover after every use. I've scraped the grills; emptied the drip pan. 30 months is unacceptable! My former Weber grill lasted 20 YEARS before I had to rebuild. I suppose Weber quality is now worse than in its past and won't buy another Weber.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: one problem with the unit is the grate spaces are ...
customer_reviews.text: one problem with the unit is the grate spaces are too large and food drops down between them. the grill heats equally but not hot enough. the cast iron grate is also hard to clean, where a ceramic grate would be much easier to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph E. Bellon

customer_reviews.title: We'll be grilling all summer long.
customer_reviews.text: Just used the grill for the first time last evening. I was hesitant about buying a propane grill because of the whole coal=flavor thing. Well, I was certainly mistaken! The weirdly named "flavoring bars" on this thing work! We grilled mushrooms and asparagus and tortillas and potatoes, and everything tasted absolutely amazing! The smoky flavor comes from the food drippings falling onto the hot metal flavoring bars and, well, burning. Husband was able to put it together in an hour or so. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Cookworm

customer_reviews.title: Spend the xtra $, it will save you alot of $$$$$!
customer_reviews.text: Finally retired my old weber gas grill after 22 years of hard service. It still worked fine but It was time. My new weber 2 burner was a piece of cake to put together, great, easy directions and built like a BMW. Even though it is only 2 burner, it is much deeper plus has storage underneath. Most of it is stainless steel and very easy to clean. It has a battery igniter that works so well and mine has gone 600 degrees for searing meats. Also bought rotisserie.
customer_reviews.author: BoobearTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. Took me 3 hours to put together to ...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Took me 3 hours to put together to find out that it has a 5 inch crack on the side lid cover. Received a replacement that is DOA. Unacceptable. Also wanted to add picture of the first DOA product received. Side panel was bent.
customer_reviews.author: Tony L.

customer_reviews.title: Great value for quality
customer_reviews.text: Great little grill. Relatively easy to put together (took about an hour) decent instructions. There are cheaper small grills out there but this one is much more sturdy and the cover and cooking chamber is more robust and substantial.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Bourque

customer_reviews.title: leaking hose connection
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Spirit. The first one had worked fine for two years. The regulator hose on the new one leaked on the bottle connection end, and seems cheaply made. The connection was threaded correctly, tightened adequately, etc. I ended up using the old line and regulator from my old Genesis Silver. The difference in quality between the two is apparent. The item was shipped on time.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Great in So Many Ways
customer_reviews.text: We recently moved out of state. We have been busy buying a lot of stuff for the new house and I have been busy doing a lot of 'some assembly required.' Most of the items needing assembly have been disappointing to impossible (really impossible). The Weber grill was a breath of fresh air. It is an amazing feat of sheet metal design and production. Every piece aligned perfectly without having to tweak or bend or force alignment. It looks good, works well, and looks like it will last. Well worth the extra you pay for Weber.
customer_reviews.author: davel4wa

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Grill
customer_reviews.text: Great grill, sturdy construction. It was a bit of a deliberation if it was worth the premium, 20+% than comparable grills I was looking at. But after several weeks of use, I am really happy with the heat control and overall quality of Weber.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect grill!
customer_reviews.text: First grill I've ever purchased. Never looking back. I did extensive research trying to find the perfect grill. This thing has two burners and that's all you'll need. I've hosted a few parties of more than 10 people with no problems. It heats up fast, retains heat, cooks evenly, Sears beautify, and cleans easily. Just needs a tad bit more shelf space. Otherwise I'm very impressed. Special thanks to www.thesweethome.com for their team's exhaustive research!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: I can never get the grill to get hot, ...
customer_reviews.text: I can never get the grill to get hot, even after 15 minutes it doesn't go above 325 degrees! I'm in process of looking for a new grill. I thought that buying a Weber grill would mean quality, but even the cheap knock off gas grills at least get hot enough to cook....
customer_reviews.author: Joe Kleinhenz

customer_reviews.title: Great grill, wish it was hotter
customer_reviews.text: Grill works very well, solid construction. Overall very happy with my purchase, though I wish that the grill was a little closer to the burners in order to get a more intense sear, does not achieve wicked hot temps of more expensive grills, if it could just get a little hotter it would be perfect, also the door to the gas compartment had a slight dent in it upon delivery, but not a big deal
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Pfister

customer_reviews.title: Great for small places
customer_reviews.text: We have a condo with a small balcony, so we were looking for something small. This has the perfect size, we use it several times a week. Happy to have purchased this version, with the compartment hiding the propane tank. It is very compact and enough for 2-4 people. For a large party, this probably is too small. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon user

customer_reviews.title: Love this BBQ grill
customer_reviews.text: Had assembly done via Amazon and the technician was friendly, efficient and fast. The grill is awesome and cooks perfectly. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: JR in OC

customer_reviews.title: You should buy this grill
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this grill. It took about an hour and a half to assemble just because there are so many parts, but it was straightforward and the instructions were great. My grill did suffer a little damage in shipping, but Weber sent me replacement parts free of charge right away. I love the folding side tables..they are very sturdy unlike many out there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little barbeque and perfect for my small backyard and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little barbeque and perfect for my small backyard and patio. I was able to assemble it by myself (the instructions do tell you to use two people for lifting and installing certain parts which I am sure is the safer option) in about two hours. All the pieces were included, but the only negative is that some of the metal was bent. It didn't stop me from being able to put it all together, but the end result is not as seamless as I would want in a brand new product. In any case, the barbeque ignited on the very first try, and I am looking forward to a summer of delicious grilling!
customer_reviews.author: Eris00

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, but packaging could use some improvement
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived on time, but packaging showed substantial damage and had obviously been dropped. I accepted the shipment, as it appeared to be well packed, which may have been a mistake. As it turned out, the base plate was a bit banged up on the back side, but primarily cosmetic and not disabling. As far as the product goes, it is excellent! I am quite pleased - heats up very quickly, enough room under the cover so the heat can be well-controlled, nice grills, and I particularly like the burner arrangement. A good value!
customer_reviews.author: bcrgus

customer_reviews.title: ... the previous 3 -- and it is just as wonderful as my previous Weber
customer_reviews.text: I went smaller - 2 burners versus the previous 3 -- and it is just as wonderful as my previous Weber. Plenty of room to cook for the family and friends - and accurate heat etc - all the good Weber qualities
customer_reviews.author: RHC

customer_reviews.title: but cooks pretty darn well and is built pretty sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have a lot of bells or whistles, but cooks pretty darn well and is built pretty sturdy. Flame control is consistent with good range - gets hot enough to sear or low enough to slow roast, and the burner area is deep to help prevent flareups.
customer_reviews.author: Brian E Beaty

customer_reviews.title: Delivered with bent panel and parts but Weber quickly corrected....
customer_reviews.text: Got to the second last assembly step when I discovered the front door was badly dented. A call to Weber on a Sunday solved the problem. Great customer Service!
customer_reviews.author: Gary J. Ponich

customer_reviews.title: Weber quality is top notch
customer_reviews.text: Grill has a perfect surface size. I never used burners, etc. and always lots of unused space on surface.
customer_reviews.author: Laura J. Flemming

customer_reviews.title: So good!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a great grill. We've been using this grill for two months, purchased to replace another grill we had. The burgers, chicken wings, eggplant, etc. are SO much better on this grill than they ever were on my old grill, I had no idea they could be this good. Also, I assembled this myself in one evening with absolutely no issues. Just need a quiet time and no one rushing you.
customer_reviews.author: E. V. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Webber Quaility
customer_reviews.text: I have bought many cheaper BBQ's and have replace them in a few short seasons. You can tell immediately that Webber's are better. Instructions were very detailed and this went together as expected. it warms up fast and cleans easily. This is a small to medium sized BBQ, but holds 12 burgers. I recommend this a buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pain to Assemble but great overall value
customer_reviews.text: Took about 1 hr to assemble but it all fit together perfectly - screw driver and 11mm socket. Great Overall BBQ
customer_reviews.author: cbreed

customer_reviews.title: POOR quality control.  Bent pieces in a brand new grill.
customer_reviews.text: Love Weber grills, but part way along the assembly process, we discover that the pieces shipped along with the grill are bent. Either someone returned this and its not a new grill, or the Weber quality control is horrible. Like so many US brands, it's not what it used to be. AVOID.
customer_reviews.author: WoodsManinMI

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic grill!
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this grill. I was hesitant to buy due to a few reviews on how slow it heats up, but I've had no problems! Was easy to assemble, starts super easy and fast, and takes just a few minutes to heat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact gas grill
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace our Weber Q 100 grill, and have been very happy with it as an adjunct to our much larger charcoal grill. It's compact but still big enough to grill a whole chicken, or a whole pile of burgers. Heats up to over 500 F in about 15 minutes, and gets plenty hot for a gas grill, too. Overall I'm very satisfied with the Spirit E210. My only quibble is that the heat isn't uniformly distributed over the grill surface. Once you learn where the heat is you can place your grillables appropriately.
customer_reviews.author: welos2

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter Grill!
customer_reviews.text: We live in an apartment with a one car garage, so space is limited. This grill was just the ticket. The fact that you can fold the side-tables down sold me. Coming from a small portable gas camping grill, this was the perfect "starter" grill. Heats up quickly, retains the heat, and just and overall nice build quality that is expected of the Weber name. It stays in the garage so no sign of rust yet! Would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a place to start.
customer_reviews.author: The_Lumin8or

customer_reviews.title: Great grill -- easy to assemble, cooks well and looks good!
customer_reviews.text: I love my new grill! I read reviews that said it was pretty easy to assemble. When I first looked at the picture instructions, I was a little apprehensive, but once I started put it together, it was very easy. I am a woman in her 50's and had no trouble lifting the heaviest parts. The 310 series may have required assistance, but I was able to assemble the E-210 all by myself! I love the propane gauge, the auto-ignite button, and the way it cooks. Very nice and pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Irwin

product_meta.title: Weber 46110001 Spirit E-210 Gas Grill | Liquid Propane, 2-Burner | Black
product_meta.description: Taste the difference A spirit will make in your life. With features such as porcelain-enameled, cast-iron cooking grates that retain even heat, you’re guaranteed the best tasting food. It’s built to last with a cookbook that won’t rust or peal over time & Conveniently equipped with six tool hooks for easy accessibility of grilling tools. If that wasn't enough, the low maintenance & easy-to-clean grease Management system takes the hassle out of cooking. Designed to fit on a small patio or balcony, The spirit E-210 gas grill brings grilling to any home. Total cooking area (square inches) - 450
feature_bullets: Your purchase includes One Weber Spirit E-210 Liquid Propane Gas Grill. Cover is not included | Assembly required

Grill dimensions: Lid Open – 63" H x 50" W x 32" D | Lid Closed – 45.5" H x 50" W x 24" D | Primary cooking area – 360 square inches | Warming rack area – 90 square inches | Total cooking area – 450 square inches/20.4” W x 17.5” D | Weight – 113.8
Heavy-duty caster wheels for easily moving your grill on grass or a patio
Built to last with heavy duty, porcelain-enameled lid and cook box that will not rust or peal over time
Six tool hooks for easy accessibility of grilling tools. Low maintenance and easy-to-clean grease Management system

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,194 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
